modelCorrections.afterModification: <input type="submit" class="hs-button primary large" style="color: #ffffff; background-color: #00736b;" value="Subscribe">
modelCorrections.rawOutput:
To address the WCAG 2.1 violation described, we need to adjust either the foreground color (text color) or the background color to achieve a contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1. Given the original colors (foreground color: #ffffff, background color: #00a9a4) and the specified font size and weight, the contrast ratio is currently 2.91, which is below the required threshold.

- Thought: Since the foreground color is white (#ffffff), adjusting the background color to make it darker would be a straightforward solution to improve contrast without affecting the readability or aesthetic appeal significantly. I'll choose a darker shade of the original background color (#00a9a4) to maintain the visual design integrity while ensuring the contrast ratio meets or exceeds the 4.5:1 requirement.

- Corrected HTML: `<input type="submit" class="hs-button primary large" style="color: #ffffff; background-color: #00736b;" value="Subscribe">`

This alteration changes the background color to a darker shade (#00736b), which should sufficiently increase the contrast ratio with the white text to meet the WCAG 2.1 standards. This approach maintains the original design's intent while ensuring accessibility compliance.
